review.title: Multilingual lexicon design tool and database management system for MT
review.abstract: The paper presents the design and development of English-Lithuanian-English dictionarylexicon tool and lexicon database management system for MT. The system is oriented to support two main requirements: to be open to the user and to describe much more attributes of speech parts as a regular dictionary that are required for the MT. Programming language Java and database management system MySql is used to implement the designing tool and lexicon database respectively. This solution allows easily deploying this system in the Internet. The system is able to run on various OS such as: Windows, Linux, Mac and other OS where Java Virtual Machine is supported. Since the modern lexicon database managing system is used, it is not a problem accessing the same database for several users.

metadata.title: MULTILINGUAL LEXICON DESIGN TOOL AND DATABASE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR MT

sections.text: The essay presents the conception and development of the English-Lithuanian-English dictionary and the Dictionary Database Management System for MT. The system is designed to support two main requirements: to be open to the user and to describe many more attributes of the language parts than a normal dictionary required for MT. Java and the database management system MySql are used to implement the design tool and / or the lexicon database. This solution enables the easy use of this system on the Internet. The system can be run on different operating systems, such as: Windows, Linux, Mac and other operating systems where Java Virtual Machine is supported. As the modern lexicon database management system is used, it is no problem for several users to access the same database. Keywords: lexicon, computer-based translation, Mysql, database management.

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: The design and development of English-Lithuanian-English (ELE) dictionary lexicontool and lexicon database management system (DMS) for MT is designed to support two main requirements: to be open to the user and to describe many more attributes of language parts than regular dictionaries required for MT. Currently, the lexicon is designed to support all parts of the language for Lithuanian and English languages. In this way, it is possible to extend the same database for other language pairs as well. The problem of polysemy is the addition of an additional table between two tables linking different translations of the word in the target language. Translations for the same words are listed in descending priority in both directions. In this way, it is possible to ensure that even if the translation will not be very accurate, the user will be able to choose the appropriate words themselves. An opportunity to include additional contexts for the vocabulary to be translated first, according to the vocabulary to the highest priority to be chosen.

sections.heading: 4. Multilingual Lexicon design and database management tools
sections.text: We have chosen a very flexible way of implementing our lexicon (Barisevi ius, ernys2004). Since we define our queries to the data with SQL (Standard Query Language), so that the exact DMS is not essential (we use MySql). Using DMS makes the lexicon easy to change: add new attributes, delete or change names or types, etc. It is possible to extend the same database to other human languages as well. Since MySql can store up to 2 GB of data, we no longer need to worry about volumes. An ongoing test with a database of 20 million words and retrieval of the first word took 0.03 seconds, which was longer due to the connection to the database. The retrieval time of the following searches was less than 0.01 seconds. We considered the domain option for nouns, so the user can select the priority of searching for words in a particular domain.

sections.heading: 5. Conclusions
sections.text: The English-Lithuanian-English Dictionary Dictionary Dictionary Tool and the Dictionary Database Management System for the MT are geared towards two main requirements: openness to the user and description of many more attributes of the language parts than a normal dictionary required for the MT. Java and MySql are used as programming languages to implement the design tool and / or the lexicon database, which makes it easy to use this system on the Internet. The system can be run on various operating systems supporting Java Virtual Machine. Currently, only one lexicographer can work on the system at the same time, but the import (merging two dictionaries into one) is underway. Research work is being carried out in accordance with the national program "Lithuanian Language in the Information Society for the years 2005-2006 for the development of Lithuanian language technologies, including computer-assisted translation." The tool was dismantled in the DWS Dictionary Writing System on September 2004, on the 6th of October 2004, and at the University of Brno on the 6th of October 2004.
